reviewText: My family and I love reading the book and watching the DVD of "The Gruffalo" so we were excited when the DVD "Room on the Broom" which is also by Julia Donaldson was released. In the movie, Room on the Broom, a witch and her cat take a journey on the witches broom. On their ride they continuously lose items which are found by other animals. These animals join the witch and cat on their trip.  The cat learns a few lessons on kindness and cooperation.  My kids loved that the squirrel and snake from The Gruffalo make an appearance at the beginning of the movie. Adorable movie!
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: I was a little unsure when we ordered this movie. I just wasn't sure if it would really be something my two and a half year old would pay attention to. It looked like very beautiful animation, and sometimes, honestly, I think she just gets bored if it isn't bright and "super animated" if you know what I mean. WOW was this mama wrong. We received this movie in the mail right before heading out on a car trip that ended up being about two hours- and we watched this movie the WHOLE time. So, about 2.5 times total I guess? She was immediately captured by the fantastic animation, and the well-crafted story. She liked pointing out all the animals, and pointing out when the witch dropped her want "oh no! "and repeating the recognizable "is there room on the broom for me" phrase- which was adorable. She also was very interested in the insert with all the rest of the books by the author Julia Donaldson- and asked if we could "get all of them". We went to the library the next day and she was very happy to find ALL of the books there on the shelf waiting for her. Not only is this a great movie- but a great way to make reading more fun too!
summary: A beautiful story and great fun for our todddler.
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: I love how this DVD kept to the book so well. This DVD just helps visualize the story with a few additions to make the story flow and more interesting. The book is one of my daughter's favorites and she loves the movie as well.
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: My family has been a fan of this book for some time and it definitely is one that I know that my children have asked me to read many times in the past. So you can guess that we were very excited to see that this great story was now being released as a video too. In watching this movie as a family I have to say that they have done a great job at capturing the wonderful feel of the book itself and added on some additional mannerisms about each of the characters that you cannot specifically see in the book which made the characters deeper with a longer back story.I also have to say that we enjoyed also watching the bonus features. This was the first time that we have been introduced to the author and gave us a more intimate knowledge to why the book was made in the way it was.All-in-all this movie does a great job at capturing all aspects of the book itself and whether you have read the book or not you too will like this as well.*I received a copy for review - all opinions are my own*
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: One of our favorite kids books (both for story and illustrations) this animation PERFECTLY captures the essence of the book. Given that the actual text of the book is pretty short, I wondered how they had stretched it out, but have no fear, it's done in a very organic and enjoyable manner. The animation itself feels very painterly and is truly top-notch.
summary: A Great Animated Version of a Fantastic Book
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: This is a clever little film about a witch who needs to create room on her broomstick for her cat, a dog, a frog, and a bird, and and also fights a silly  dragon in the process.  It is a darling tale and is a perfect Halloween story, especially for preschool-aged children. My three year old son loved it, and I know it will be a Halloween tradition for our young family to watch for years to come.
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: My family and I watched a copy of "Room on the Broom" by Julia Donaldson and Max Lang.  My husband let both my kids view this while I was out for the day and then when I got home I heard so many wonderful things about it that we all watched it together!  The animation is soft and lovely and take right from the books illustrations.  The story is of a kind witch who allows many animal friends that she encounters along her flight a ride on her broom!  Her new friends include a bird and a frog and a dog.  With all the added cargo her broom snaps in half and she is captured by a dragon!  Her animal friends covered in a muddy disguise rescue her from the dragon.  It's a very nice little story and my children enjoyed it very much!  I would recommend it for all ages, heck I loved it myself!  It would be a fine addition for Halloween but really anytime is a good time for this one!
summary: An immediate hit in my home!
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: I had the book first- my children 5 & 2 love it - the little movie matches it almost word for word and keeps their interest.
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: Watched this with my 5 year old granddaughter and anxious to share it with 2 year old granddaughter as it is appropriate across the childhood (and adult!) lifespan. What a lovely story about sharing and caring.
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: I first saw this as part of an Oscar short features presentation. As soon as the movie was over, I ordered copies for my grandchildren. They and their parents loved it as much as I did.
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: My girls love it, its a great adaptation from the book. The first time they watched it they found the dragon a bit scary but after they kept asking to watch it again. They actually really enjoy watching the short little skit included as well.
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: This is the Animated Short that SHOULD have won the Oscar this year.  Wonderful.  Nice story, especially for a family, fun animation, and good music.  And for the animation buff, there is a "making of" documentary on the disc.
summary: Wonderful short film for the family
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: My children loved this! My oldest daughter is 10, so she wasn't very interested in it, but my other children (8, 6, and 4) all loved it. My youngest son's favorite was the cat because he loves cats. When my oldest child was 3 or 4, she probably would have been scared of the dragon, but her brothers weren't! I loved how the only dialog in the movie is the narration of the book. What a wonderful way to bring a great book to life. I love the lesson of friendship and working together.
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: What a great little story. My wife and I really enjoyed this dvd. So did our 7 year old. It's not all that long, but has a very good story. It has a Wallace and Gromit style of animation. It's also has good life lessons. If you liked The Gruffalo, you should like this too. I think it's probably best suited for young children. But like I said my wife and I really enjoyed it and we're in our 40's.
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: The book is wonderful, but the movie is even better! We have to watch it every day with our granddaughters, but that's fine with us because it is so well-done.
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: I highly recommend this amazing story and will gladly watch and share it with everyone. With a great lesson like The Giving Tree.. "Kindness"
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: We were so lucky this month, as a part of the NSider review program from NCircle, to receive a complimentary copy of the "Room on the Broom" dvd, based on the popular "Room on the Broom" book. This is such a cute adaption of the book. If you have not read the book, it's a story about a witch and her cat riding the witch's broom, they meet new characters along the way who ask if there's "room on the broom" for them. The witch is kind and finds room on her broom for everyone, although her cat is annoyed by her choice to let them all ride the broom. In the end a dragon burns her broom and captures the witch and all of the characters she has made room on the broom for ban together and rescue her. I think it's an adorable lesson for all ages of "treat others how you would like to be treated". The animation is simple and not full of bright colors like a lot of children's animation, but it is simply beautiful. The story in the dvd follows the text exactly as it is in the book. "Room on the Broom" is a fun film that all children and parents can appreciate.
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: This is such a fun book to read, written very well, we love it and they've done a great job of turning it into a movie. So that you know it is not a full length movie but wonderful just the same. Even if you don't buy this movie, trust me and get the book you won't be disappointed.
Title: Room on the Broom anglais

reviewText: I am not a big fan of witches and what they represent but I like to keep an open mind so I was willing to give the Room on the Broom a shot. Considering it's immediate popularity, I knew it couldn't be filled with evil as I imagine most witch stories to be.I read through the book alone at first and really enjoyed the witty rhymes and cute, unique story. The witch is actually the friendly sort and when she gets aid from friends, she returns their kindness. It is not at all what I would expect from a witch story and when I realized the story was harmless, I read it to my kids.They both loved the story and immediately wanted to watch the DVD. The DVD is basically the story come to life. The only words are those from the book. I really liked this because the kids really had to pay attention and see all that happened between the dialogue. Actions really do speak louder than words.The only concern I'd have for younger children is the dragon is a little bit frightening. My four year old got a little scared when he showed up but when I asked if she wanted me to turn it off she said no. And then when it was over she asked to watch it again and said it wasn't that scary now that she'd seen the whole thing.Room on the Broom is adorable and quirky and truly unique. It's message of helping others and friendship is priceless.
Title: Room on the Broom anglais
